description.narrative:
This grant will fund an independent evaluation for the Behind the Brands implementation initiative.
In 2013, Oxfam initiated a groundbreaking campaign, Behind the Brands, to challenge 10 of the largest food and beverage companies to improve their economic, social, and environmental performance. This initiative has drawn the support of almost a quarter million advocates and spurred well-knowncompanies to make unprecedented commitments. Eight of the Big 10 companies # Coca-Cola, General Mills, Kellogg,Mars, Mondelez, Nestle, PepsiCo and Unilever # endorsed the UN Women#s Empowerment Principles. Since then, Oxfam has been engaging with companies to ensure that they follow through on their commitments, through the Behind the Brands Implementation Initiative.
While 8 of the Big 10 (excluding ABF and Danone) have endorsed the principles, progress on implementation is uneven, with some companies carrying our women#s empowerment initiatives, or company leadership regularly demonstrating public support forthe WEPs, and others making little headway since their endorsement. Oxfam has tracked WEP signatories and some evidence of implementation in the Behind the Brands scorecard, and then internally in the years since. The evaluation will assess the extent towhich these companies have implemented the WEPs and, provide recommendations for how food and beverage companies can demonstrate leadership and push for gender equality in their supply chains. In addition to being published separately, the evaluation willalso be included in the Behind the Brands 2021 report, in which Oxfam will publicly assess progress of the Big 10 companies on their land, climate, and gender-related commitments.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam America is one of the Oxfam affiliates. In 1970, Oxfam America became an independent nonprofit organization and an Oxfam affiliate in response to the humanitarian crisis created by the fight for independence in Bangladesh. Oxfam America's headquarters are located in Boston, Massachusetts with a policy and campaigns office in Washington, D.C. and seven regional offices around the world. Oxfam Novib works collaboratively with Oxfam US on a number of PS Projects, especially on value chains. Oxfam US provides grants andtechnical support to local organizations around the world. Together with these partners, we support long-term solutions that help poor communities grow nutritious food, access land and clean water, and obtain decent work and fair wages.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: Improved policies Private Sector: # cases where Oxfam/partners influenced private sector actors to adopting/implementing improved policies on (i) Sustainable Food production & consumption, (ii) Land Rights (iii) Climate Change with a gender senstive lens.
